title: Are We Addicted to Smartphones? Stats Reveals Usage Gap Between Gen Z vs Boomers - Softonic EN
summary:
Are We Addicted to Smartphones? Stats Reveal Usage Gap Between Gen Z vs Boomers

Publication Date: 2024-09-26 | Source: Softonic

This article explores the dramatic rise in smartphone usage worldwide, examining the differences in smartphone habits between Generation Z and Baby Boomers. With nearly 5 billion smartphone users globally, the implications of this trend are immense.

  • Approximately 4.88 billion people worldwide own a smartphone; expected to reach 6 billion by 2027.
  • The average person spends about 4 hours and 37 minutes on their smartphone daily.
  • Gen Zers report spending an average of 6 hours and 5 minutes on smartphones.
  • Smartphone usage in the U.S. shows a steady increase, reflecting a growing addiction to mobile technology.
"36% of Americans believe they have a screen time addiction."

The increase in smartphone use continues to raise questions about digital addiction and its social implications.
newTitle: Are We Addicted to Smartphones? Stats Reveal Usage Gap Between Gen Z vs Boomers

title: ChatGPT for macOS now compatible with Apple Notes and other apps - Bizz Buzz
I thought the tri-folding Huawei Mate XT was a gimmick, but then I held it - TechRadar
summary:
First Impressions of the Huawei Mate XT: A Revolutionary Tri-Folding Smartphone

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: TechRadar

The Huawei Mate XT is the world’s first commercially available dual-screen, tri-folding smartphone. Initial skepticism about its practicality seems misplaced after a hands-on experience, revealing the device's impressive build and unique design.

  • The Huawei Mate XT features a unique tri-fold design, offering three displays yet compressing into a portable size.
  • It measures 6.4 inches when collapsed and expands to 10.2 inches when fully unfolded.
  • The device is equipped with a Kirin 9010 chipset, 16GB RAM, and storage options from 256GB to 1TB.
  • The phone boasts a solid build quality with robust hinges that hold positions without flopping.
  • It includes a three-lens rear camera setup, consisting of a 50MP main lens, a 12MP ultra-wide lens, and a 12MP periscope lens, plus an 8MP selfie camera.
“Seeing is believing, but feeling is the truth.”

The Huawei Mate XT is not yet available globally, but its design hints at a promising future for foldable technology, showcasing a potential shift that could make folding phones more practical and appealing.
newTitle: First Impressions of the Huawei Mate XT: A Revolutionary Tri-Folding Smartphone

title: Will Samsung release One UI 7 Beta for Galaxy S23 and S22 series users? - Sammy Fans
summary:
Will Samsung release One UI 7 Beta for Galaxy S23 and S22 series users?

Publication Date: December 2023   Source: Sammy Fans

The One UI 7 Beta Program is now available for the Galaxy S24 series, but its availability for Galaxy S23 and S22 series is still uncertain. Users can join the Beta Program to experience new features ahead of the public rollout.

  • The public rollout of One UI 7 is scheduled for Q1 2025.
  • The One UI Beta Program provides users a preview of features in development.
  • Samsung has historically expanded the Beta program to older models after launching it for new flagships.
  • There are indications that the Galaxy S23 series could receive the Beta soon, based on a recently created landing page.
  • The Galaxy S22 series might get limited access, potentially only in select markets.
  • Rumors suggest the Beta for both S23 and S22 series could align with the rollout of the third Beta for the S24 series on December 23.
“The final One UI 7 version is said to be introduced on January 22.”

The future roadmap for One UI 7 and eligible Galaxy models is awaited, with general availability expected by the end of Q1 2025.
newTitle: Will Samsung release One UI 7 Beta for Galaxy S23 and S22 series users?

title: ChatGPT for macOS now compatible with Apple Notes and other apps - India Today
summary:
ChatGPT for macOS now compatible with Apple Notes and other apps

Published On: Dec 21, 2024

Published By: Aman Rashid

OpenAI has introduced a new update for the ChatGPT app on macOS, enhancing its functionality by allowing integration with popular note-taking and coding applications.

  • ChatGPT can now interact with apps like Apple Notes, VSCode, and more, offering real-time assistance to users.
  • This feature is currently available only for paid subscribers but will roll out to free users next year.
  • The integration allows users to activate ChatGPT in any supported app using the shortcut Option + Space.
  • Privacy controls are in place, ensuring users manage when and how ChatGPT interacts with their apps.
“ChatGPT can now work with approximately 30 macOS apps,” said Kevin Weil, Chief Product Officer at OpenAI.

This update enriches user productivity by allowing seamless access to ChatGPT's capabilities directly within applications.
newTitle: ChatGPT for macOS now compatible with Apple Notes and other apps

title: New iQOO 13 update rolling out, fixes Dark Mode and App Compatibility issues - NerdsChalk
summary:
New iQOO 13 update rolling out, fixes Dark Mode and App Compatibility issues

Date: December 2024

Source: NerdsChalk

iQOO has just released a new software update for the iQOO 13, bringing several improvements and fixes that users have been waiting for. The update weighs in at around 748 MB, and it is packed with enhancements for Dark Mode, third-party apps, and overall system security.

  • Key Points:
    • System updated with December 2024 Google security patch.
    • Optimized Dark Mode to fix display issues in apps and system interfaces.
    • Improved compatibility for third-party apps to resolve crashes.
  • Update Version Details:
    • Device: iQOO 13
    • Software Version: PD2408F-EX-A-15.0.10.8.W30
    • File Size: Approx. 748 MB
  • How to Update:
    • Check for updates in Settings > System Update.
    • Ensure stable internet and at least 50% battery to download and install.
    • Device will reboot automatically upon installation completion.

Stay tuned for more news on upcoming updates and features!
newTitle: iQOO 13 Update Enhances Dark Mode and App Compatibility

title: Google Releases Android 16 2nd Developer Preview Update; Check Details - LatestLY
Apple AirDrop could work with Samsung phones - Sammy Fans
summary:
Apple AirDrop Could Work with Samsung Phones

Publication Date: December 19, 2024
Source: Sammy Fans

The European Union is pushing Apple to extend the interoperability of its services like AirDrop and AirPlay to work alongside Android systems, including Samsung devices, thus potentially opening up cross-platform functionality.

  • The EU is proposing several changes for interoperability, focusing on features for interactivity, data transfer, and device setup.
  • Apple is mandated to allow third parties access to the AirDrop API, ensuring effective functionality similar to that available to Apple users.
  • Increased accessibility to updates for AirDrop by third parties is also demanded to allow seamless file transfers.
  • Apple is required to implement these measures in the next major iOS release by the end of 2025.
“Apple shall provide effective interoperability with the AirDrop feature.”

The push for interoperability is part of broader EU regulations aimed at promoting competition and user choice in the tech industry.
newTitle: Apple AirDrop Could Become Compatible with Samsung Devices

  • Los Santos is experiencing rare snowfall and holiday decorations.
  • New vehicles available for purchase include the Invetero Coquette D10 Pursuit and the Willard Outreach Faction.

  • Players logging in between December 19 and January 1 can receive holiday gifts, including festive clothing and weapons.
  • The Entourage (Festive Remix) mode offers triple rewards for players seeking extra GTA$ and RP.
“This holiday season, GTA Online brings new content and bonuses to keep the festivities going strong.”

In conclusion, the festive updates in GTA Online aim to enhance player experience during the holiday season, encouraging participation in seasonal events and special rewards.

Apple May Rename iPhone SE 4 as iPhone 16e - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
Apple May Rename iPhone SE 4 as iPhone 16e

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Apple is expected to launch the iPhone SE 4 early next year, with rumors suggesting a potential rename to iPhone 16e to join the iPhone 16 series lineup.

The upcoming budget iPhone is set to align with features and designs from the iPhone 16 series including a 6.1-inch display and enhanced AI capabilities.

  • Display: 6.1-inch display, upgrading from the previous 4.7-inch.
  • Camera: 48MP main lens compared to the 12MP of iPhone SE 3.
  • OLED Display: Expected upgrade from LCD to OLED technology.
  • Battery: 3279 mAh capacity used in iPhone 14.
  • Chipset: Rumored to feature the A18 chipset.
  • RAM: 8GB, improving AI technology support.
  • Charging Port: USB-C, aligning with new flagship models.

Anticipated launch for the iPhone SE 4/iPhone 16e is set for March 2025.
newTitle: Apple May Rename iPhone SE 4 as iPhone 16e
